ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Global Assessment Scale (GAS): At worst point during current episode
Global Assessment Scale (GAS): During past month

Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime
e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Rate the child/adolescents most impaired level of general functioning during the specified period rated by selecting the lowest level which describes his/her functioning on a hypothetical continuum of health-illness.
Rate actual functioning regardless of treatment or prognosis.
Please detail the basis for the C-GAS rating by listing the details of the patient''s functioning in each of the domains outlined below: Family Relations
Please detail the basis for the C-GAS rating by listing the details of the patient''s functioning in each of the domains outlined below: Peer Relations
Please detail the basis for the C-GAS rating by listing the details of the patient''s functioning in each of the domains outlined below: School Functioning
Please detail the basis for the C-GAS rating by listing the details of the patient''s functioning in each of the domains outlined below: Other
Please detail the basis for the C-GAS rating by listing the details of the patient''s functioning in each of the domains outlined below: Depressive Symptoms
Global Assessment Scale (GAS): During last week
Notes: Past Week GAS. Reflects lowest level of functioning in the last week
